get.description: Get the upstreaming behavior of a package within the context of a feed

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: The name or id of the feed

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: The name of the package

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

patch.description:
Set the upstreaming behavior of a package within the context of a feed

The package does not need to necessarily exist in the feed prior to setting the behavior.
This assists with packages that are not yet ingested from an upstream, yet the feed owner wants
to apply a specific behavior on the first ingestion.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: The name or id of the feed

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: The name of the package

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The behavior to apply to the package within the scope of the feed

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

delete.description:
Send a package version from the feed to its paired recycle bin.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package to delete.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package to delete.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Get information about a package version.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: showDeleted
parameters.description: True to include deleted packages in the response.

patch.description:
Set mutable state on a package version.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New state to apply to the referenced package.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package to update.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package to update.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
Download a package version directly.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: sourceProtocolVersion
parameters.description: Unused

post.description:
Update several packages from a single feed in a single request. The updates to the packages do not happen atomically.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information about the packages to update, the operation to perform, and its associated data.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

delete.description:
Delete a package version from a feed's recycle bin.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.
delete.operationId: NuGet_Delete Package Version From Recycle Bin

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

get.description:
View a package version's deletion/recycled status

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

patch.description:
Restore a package version from a feed's recycle bin back into the active feed.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.
patch.operationId: NuGet_Restore Package Version From Recycle Bin

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Set the 'Deleted' member to 'false' to apply the restore operation

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: packageName
parameters.description: Name of the package.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: Version of the package.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

post.description:
Delete or restore several package versions from the recycle bin.

The project parameter must be supplied if the feed was created in a project.
If the feed is not associated with any project, omit the project parameter from the request.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information about the packages to update, the operation to perform, and its associated data. <c>Operation</c> must be <c>PermanentDelete</c> or <c>RestoreToFeed</c>

parameters.name: feedId
parameters.description: Name or ID of the feed.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

BatchListData.description: Data required to unlist or relist multiple package versions. Pass this while performing NuGetBatchOperationTypes.List batch operation.

listed.description: The desired listed status for the package versions.

BatchOperationData.description: Do not attempt to use this type to create a new BatchOperationData. This type does not contain sufficient fields to create a new batch operation data.

JsonPatchOperation.description: The JSON model for a JSON Patch operation

from.description: The path to copy from for the Move/Copy operation.

path.description: The path for the operation. In the case of an array, a zero based index can be used to specify the position in the array (e.g. /biscuits/0/name). The "-" character can be used instead of an index to insert at the end of the array (e.g. /biscuits/-).

value.description: The value for the operation. This is either a primitive or a JToken.

MinimalPackageDetails.description: Minimal package details required to identify a package within a protocol.

NuGetPackagesBatchRequest.description: A batch of operations to apply to package versions.

data.description: Data required to perform the operation. This is optional based on the type of the operation. Use BatchPromoteData if performing a promote operation.

operation.description: Type of operation that needs to be performed on packages.

values.description: Promote package versions to a release view. If constructing a NuGetPackagesBatchRequest object with this type, use BatchPromoteData for its Data property. Not supported in the Recycle Bin.
Delist or relist package versions. Not supported in the Recycle Bin.
Move package versions to the feed's Recycle Bin. Not supported in the Recycle Bin.
Permanently delete package versions. Only supported in the Recycle Bin.
Restore deleted package versions to the feed. Only supported in the Recycle Bin.

packages.description: The packages onto which the operation will be performed.

NuGetPackageVersionDeletionState.description: Deletion state of a NuGet package.

deletedDate.description: Utc date the package was deleted.

deleted.description: Setting to false will undo earlier deletion and restore the package to feed.

Package.description: Package version metadata for a NuGet package

deletedDate.description: If and when the package was deleted.

listed.description: Indicates whether the package is marked as 'listed' within the NuGet protocol. If null or missing, the package's 'listed' state is unspecified.

name.description: The display name of the package.

permanentlyDeletedDate.description: If and when the package was permanently deleted.

sourceChain.description: The history of upstream sources for this package. The first source in the list is the immediate source from which this package was saved.

listed.description: Indicates the listing state of a package

views.description: The view to which the package version will be added

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

UpstreamingBehavior.description: Describes upstreaming behavior for a given feed/protocol/package

versionsFromExternalUpstreams.description: Indicates whether external upstream versions should be considered for this package

UpstreamSourceInfo.description: Upstream source definition, including its Identity, package type, and other associated information.

displayLocation.description: Locator for connecting to the upstream source in a user friendly format, that may potentially change over time

location.description: Locator for connecting to the upstream source

sourceType.description: Source type, such as Public or Internal.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.packaging: Grants the ability to read feeds and packages. Also grants the ability to search packages.
scopes.vso.packaging_manage: Grants the ability to create, read, update, and delete feeds and packages.
scopes.vso.packaging_write: Grants the ability to create and read feeds and packages.
